page.title: 02Landscape around Langho (1)
page.content: Rocks of mid-carboniferous age underlie the area , limestone below Millstone Grit , some forming a ridge running N.E. to S.W. its summit 185m.O.D. There is a small exposure above York . The ground slopes to 60m.O.D. in the North , here limestone is covered by a layer of alluvial silt and clay up to 25m. thick On the gritstone is moorland covered with coarse grass and rushes which slopes down to two reservoirs , a small pine plantation is on the S.E. ridge , a mixed wood opposite . Elsewhere apart from houses and gardens roads etc. grass covers most of the land in fields separated by hedgerows . Many small streams cross this area draining into the Park Brook , or the Ribble , a few on the Gritstone drain into the Dean Clough reservoir which supplies Accrinton .
